SEARCH
Module com.example.samplesalad
Package com.example.samplesalad.model

Class Pad

java.lang.Object
com.example.samplesalad.model.Pad
public class Pad extends Object
A triggerable object representing a pad (like on an Akai MPC), which holds and plays a sample. Includes properties for volume, pitch, BPM, key binding, and associated user.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    Pad(Sample sample)
    Initializes a new Pad with the given sample, setting default volume, BPM, and pitch to 1.

      public Pad(Sample sample)
      Initializes a new Pad with the given sample, setting default volume, BPM, and pitch to 1.
      Parameters:
      sample - The sample to be assigned to this pad.

      Returns:

    • getVolume

      public Double getVolume()
      Gets the volume of this pad.
      Returns:
      The current volume.

    • triggerPad

      public void triggerPad()
      Triggers the pad to play its assigned sample. Currently prints a debug message. Actual playback logic needs to be implemented.

    • mutePad

      public void mutePad()
      Mutes the pad. Currently prints a debug message. Actual muting logic needs to be implemented.

    • unmutePad

      public void unmutePad()
      Unmutes the pad. Currently prints a debug message. Actual unmuting logic needs to be implemented.

    • setVolume

      public void setVolume(double volume)
      Sets the volume for this pad.
      Parameters:
      volume - The new volume to set (typically between 0.0 and 1.0).

      Returns:

    • isPlaying

      public boolean isPlaying()
      Checks if the pad's sample is currently playing. Currently always returns `false`. Needs implementation to check actual playback status.
      Returns:
      `true` if the sample is playing, `false` otherwise.

    • setAudioClip

      public void setAudioClip(AudioClip audioClip) throws UnsupportedAudioFileException, LineUnavailableException, IOException
      Sets the AudioClip for this Pad
      Parameters:
      audioClip - The audioclip to set
      Throws:
      UnsupportedAudioFileException - If the file isn't supported
      LineUnavailableException - if the audio line is unavailable
      IOException - If the file can't be found or loaded
